lexUnit.name: tie.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: attach or fasten with string, cord, etc

sentence.text: Apparently the healer would tie a black thread round the horse 's ankle , and it usually worked .
He was tied to the back of a horse and taken to Edinburgh , where he was tried , convicted and hanged .
Sharpe tied the horse 's reins to the harrow 's stout frame , then slid his rifle out of its saddle holster .
` Over the trav'us door , on the top , he had a hooked ring ; and he tied the horse to this ring .
We tied our horses to a small rail and knocked on the priest 's house door .
Caspar was tied to a tree with wire fixed to Philip 's belt .
It all began when a woman threatened to tie herself to a willow tree .
Then Sapt tied the rope round one of the trees near the water .
He tied his horse to a tree outside this bushy patch and left him grazing .
Before the poor victim had a chance to scream , Mildred had tied a gag around her mouth .
Claudia , who had taken off her sweater and tied the arms around her waist , now undid the knot and pulled the sweater on again .
Sikes quickly tied the rope around the chimney , then began to tie the other end around himself , ready to lower himself to the ground behind the house .
He then tied electrical cable around the trunk and his neck before hanging himself .
You need two pieces of string and you tie a balloon loosely onto each with a loop .
He tied the reins to a handy bush and followed the sound of Blondel 's voice .
He tied two broomsticks to Da Silva 's arms and stuck one down his back , making him march up and down the corridor again and again , repeating ` I am a cripple " .
He fastened the panel from an old radio to the headboard with sticky tape and tied the driving wheel to Pete 's cardboard box with string .
He did not put up any resistance when they flung him down on the rainswept slabs , and tied his ankles with a thick cord .
Pa shrugged himself into his coat and tied a muffler about his neck to keep out the cold February wind .
I tied a tarpaulin over the car and paid a farmer with a horse to drag it through the streets of the city and out to the Plainpalais gate .
In a fit of temper Yates grabbed Nicola 's sweater , tied the sleeve round her neck and throttled her as she cried out " Daddy do n't " .
I tied them together with rope .
They were led , tied together by a single rope , first to the scaffold where , in front of the guillotine , the death sentence was pronounced .
If the door knob is cool , tie something moist around your mouth and nose and keep your face near the floor .
Tragically the rope tied around Mrs Love 's ankle slipped from her husband 's grasp and she fell to her death .
From the spot in the hedgerow where the four German soldiers had come from a white flag tied to a long piece of wood had suddenly appeared .
A rope had been thrown over a low beam in the room and tied to the top of the Bookman 's cage .
Lonie tied on an apron and hoisted herself on to a kitchen chair .
